alert.note: Alert for Erie; Genesee; Niagara; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 4:50PM EST until February 19 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in New York... Tonawanda Creek At Batavia affecting Wyoming, Erie, Niagara and Genesee Counties. .Heavy rain and snowmelt on Thursday will continue to produce a flood threat through the weekend. For the Tonawanda Creek...including Batavia...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tonawanda Creek At Batavia. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Moderate flood, flooding along West Main Street and South Main Street in Batavia and along the creek from Batavia to East Pembroke, extending to the Tonawanda Indian Reservation. Flooding will mainly impact roads, with some residential and commercial flooding possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 PM EST Friday was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.1 feet on 01/13/2018. - For more information please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 500 AM EST.
